Headline: Woman offering reward for Pandora bracelet with discontinued charms that got lost in Tampines
Text: Submitted by Stomper HuiwenThis story was submitted via Facebook. Click here to join our Facebook page.This story was submitted via Facebook. Click here to join our Facebook page.A woman is appealing for the return of her Pandora bracelet which she lost in Tampines on Sunday (June 13).Stomper Huiwen said the bracelet is likely to have fallen off at Tampines Mall, Tampines 1 or Tampines Bus Interchange between 10.45am and 12.30pm.The Pandora bracelet has a heart-shaped clasp and 14 charms (including two stoppers) in total, most of which have been discontinued and hence impossible to replace.Huiwen told Stomp: "I most probably dropped it at Tampines 1 or Tampines Bus Interchange as I was carrying quite a few bags."The Pandora bracelet was given to me by family and friends over the past five years."It is impossible to replace and I am praying hard to find it, as many of the charms have been discontinued according to Pandora staff."I am able to provide a small token of appreciation in terms of money for anyone that returns it with no questions asked."If you have found the bracelet or have any info about it, kindly contact Stomp at stomp@stomp.com.sg or WhatsApp 9384 3761.Get more of Stomp's latest updates by following us on Facebook, WhatsApp, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube.View the discussion thread.View the discussion thread.Download the new STOMP app today.SPH Digital News | The Straits TimesAll rights reserved | Terms & Conditions | Data Protection Policy | Advertise with usSPH Digital News / STOMP / Copyright (c) 2019 Singapore Press Holdings Ltd.
